ENTRY       mmu00260                    Pathway
NAME        Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism - Mus musculus (mouse)
DESCRIPTION Serine is derived from 3-phospho-D-glycerate, an intermediate of glycolysis [MD:M00020], and glycine is derived from serine. Threonine is an essential amino acid, which animals cannot synthesize. In bacteria and plants, threonine is derived from aspartate [MD:M00018].
CLASS       Metabolism; Amino acid metabolism
PATHWAY_MAP mmu00260  Glycine, serine and threonine metabolism
MODULE      mmu_M00020  Serine biosynthesis, glycerate-3P => serine [PATH:mmu00260]
            mmu_M00338  Cysteine biosynthesis, homocysteine + serine => cysteine [PATH:mmu00260]
DBLINKS     GO: 0006544 0006563 0070178 0006566
ORGANISM    Mus musculus (mouse) [GN:mmu]
GENE        71776  Tha1; threonine aldolase 1 [KO:K01620] [EC:4.1.2.48]
            20425  Shmt1; serine hydroxymethyltransferase 1 (soluble) [KO:K00600] [EC:2.1.2.1]
            108037  Shmt2; serine hydroxymethyltransferase 2 (mitochondrial) [KO:K00600] [EC:2.1.2.1]
